reviews.review: Once in a while a game comes along that proves to me that there are still developers out there willing to put 110% into a game. This is one of them. 5 stars, A+, 10/10 whatever you want to mark it as - it has full marks.
Another great game for the Bioshock franchise.
Geile Story und ein interessanter Schauplatz

Bioshock Infinite (2013) is a first-person shooter developed by Ken Levine/Irrational Games. Ken’s development team was responsible for creating the first BioShock (2007), which garnered overwhelming praise from critics and gamers for environmental storytelling, storyline, and artistic beauty of the underwater city, Rapture. BioShock Infinite garnered similar praise from both groups though there were some division within the fanbase because of the convoluted plot, plot holes, an attempt to make a very complex story gone wrong (personal opinion, but I probably already ruffle some feathers on the fan group). The game was considered as one of the most anticipated games for 2013. The game was revealed around September 2010 and it came with a full-fledge “alpha gameplay” in E3 2011. Two years later, the game was released on March 2013. I originally wrote a negative review about this game on Steam, but after playing the game for the second time, I decided to update the review and see if my views changed. Does BioShock Infinite live up to its expectation back in 2013 and years after the release date?

BioShock Infinite takes place in 1912 on Columbia, a sky-city led by Prophet Comstock. You play as Booker DeWitt, a bitter protagonist who has a mysterious past, must get Elizabeth and bring her to New York to wipe away the “debt”. The story does get complex about Elizabeth’s powers and how her powers can shape those around her. I do like the complex relationship between the two characters, which brings positive and negative interactions throughout the game. One aspect of this game I really like is the artistic talent from the developers on creating the world of Columbia. The introduction is very impactful even if the religious themes does not suit the player’s views. Still, Columbia is vibrant, artistically beautiful, and colorful. The gameplay is similar to BioShock with the use of vigors (Infinite’s version of plasmids), but Booker can only carry two weapons. Elizabeth can create “tears” for tactical purposes like turrets, debris as cover, barrels of weapons for ammunition, and various others. The story can take around 10-12 hours even with finding voxophones and exploration (for the base game). The two-episodic DLC, Burial at Sea, can take an average of five hours – depending on the player’s play style. In addition, the voice acting performances from Troy Baker (Booker DeWitt) and Elizabeth Comstock (Courtnee Draper) are outstanding and have to be commended. 

There are criticisms for BioShock Infinite. The gunplay is average – at best as the game tends to be more action-focused than its previous BioShock installations. There are similar weapon variations with the “red” weapons are weaker than the originals. Some sequences can feel like a Michael Bay movie which doesn’t fit into a BioShock game with no tactical planning and Elizabeth having limited abilities to assist Booker in firefights. The climatic battle near the end of the game is lazy and unusually anti-climactic. The worse sin is how the story became unnecessarily convoluted, causing me to have many headaches, leading to confusion, and shaking my head on the story’s inconsistencies in Infinite and the tie-ins to Burial at Sea. I usually pay close attention to the storyline. At first, I can understand what the story is leading, to but adding many plot-points in a short period of time leads to convolution. 

I wrote a negative review for BioShock Infinite back in late 2013 mainly because of the story. As of typing this review, I still dislike the story but I do appreciate what Ken Levine’s vision for BioShock Infinite due to its artistic aesthetics and art style. The game is best played on the hardest difficulty (1999 mode). Personally, it’s not a positive or a negative review but a “mixed” reception. The only reason why I gave this game a thumbs up because the positives outweighs the negatives even my personal bias lean towards not liking the game. I wish Steam has a “mixed” review (having a yellow-brownish thumb with the thumb pointing horizontally).  BioShock Infinite is a good game on its own, but not a great BioShock game.

An absolute masterpiece of gaming. This game has a vivid story that manages to reach all of your emotions. Its wonderful art style and environments inspire awe at times. You need to play this if you have not already done so!
Сюжет выносит мозг качественно и надолго. Геймплей и атмосфера стараются не отставать.

This was a fun ride of a game! The storyline is very well done, graphics are absolutely brilliant, and the adventure lasts longer than you anticipate. My only complaints are the checkpoint saving (lack of quick save or manual save), and the anticlimactic ending.

 The checkpoint saves mean if you need to leave before reaching the next checkpoint, you have to redo all your work since the last checkpoin, which can be very annoying. The ending is not really a happy ending, and it actually doesn't even make a lot of sense, but it was still such a fun game I have to give it a 9.0 out of 10 overall. I can easily recommend this game to any action first-person shooter gamer.

While the game would be better if it wasn't branded a Bioshock game it is still an excellent game with a fantastic story.

Anytime you are with Elizabeth is a delight and that you don't have to safeguard her like an escort quest such a relief.
Good Game.  Great Story.
Ein fulminantes Spektakel mit Überraschungen und ein graphisches Feuerwerk, das seines Gleichen mal finden muss!
One of the best stories in a game I've ever played well worth it.

명불허전 이레셔널게임의 바이오쇼크 시리즈
미친반전

Pocos FPS consiguen enamorar dada la sobreexplotación del género. Bioshock infinite lo consigue por su ambientación, historia y el carisma que derrocha Elisabeth.

Mi puntuación 9/10

Просто невероятная игра! Отличнейший сюжет! Особенно концовка!!! Тут всякие "Остаться в живых" и рядом не стояли! Великолепнейший визуальный ряд, в плане графики и прорисовки всего игрового мира. Просто шикарнейшие виды)) Определенно, одна из лучших игр года! В нее должен поиграть каждый) Хотя бы ради сюжета! Остался полностью доволен и удовлетворен)))) Советую всем! =) Ждем обещанные DLC ;)
игра просто прекрасна.

Me ha parecido un juego estupendo. De los que esperaba con muchas ganas el poder llegar a casa después del trabajo para poder continuarlo. La ambientación, la música, la historia, todo es desde mi punto de vista exquisito. Jugando en dificultad normal, me ha tomado 20h pasarme el juego, parando y rebuscando por todos los lados, así que se hace un poco corto, aunque tampoco he conseguido encontrar todas las cosas ocultas que tienen. La dificultad normal, si eres ya experto en este tipo de juegos es bastante fácil, hay muchas armas, municiones y vida por ahí, aparte de que Elizabeth, te sigue suministrando de todo un poco cada vez que lo necesitas. Pero al pasarte el juego desactivas la opción hardcore... un día de estos probaré, jejeje. 
Lo que me menos me ha gustado es la función de "auto-saving", no tienes una función manual para guardar la partida, así que tienes que esperar a que el juego grabe un "checkpoint" antes de salir de el para asegurarte de que no pierdes ningún avance. Tampoco hay una opción para indicar cada cuánto tiempo quieres que se grabe. No he calculado el tiempo entre uno y otro, a veces era muy rápido, según cambiabas de pantalla, o abrias puertas, y otras veces, el último checkpoint había pasado hacía mas de media hora.

I, like a lot of people, was disappointed with BioShock 2. It was a competent game, don't get me wrong. The shooting was pretty good and the story was OK. But it didn't grab me to nearly the same degree that BioShock did. Returning to Rapture. already knowing a great deal about it's history was not the same as the first trip down to this sunken Dystopia in the Bathysphere.

When I first read about BioShock Infinite, I cringed a bit because it was set in a different place, and I wondered if this was a sequel in name only. Let me assure you: it is not. Ken Levine's singular vision is back for this, the third game in the series, and it means the quality of the game, especially its story-telling and character development, has returned to that of its groundbreaking original predecessor.

I can’t really speak about the boldest aspect of the game, the ending, without spoiling it. It uses a well-worn idea from Science Fiction with great effect. I vastly appreciate its physical manifestation in Infinite, also found in the brilliant To The Moon. Succinctly it is a thoughtful ending to a fantastic game, superlative to the somewhat routine endings of its predecessors.

To Ken Levine and everyone at Irrational Games I say, bravo. Easily the best game I’ve played this year, and the best game in the BioShock series so far. I can’t wait to see where you take us next.

Story: 9/10
While playing the other Bioshocks is not a requirement, playing them first will build up to this game. The plot kept me engaged the entire time, and while certain areas did feel like filler (specifically right before the final act) the small plot twists and interesting premise, along with the great characterization, will keep you playing.

Atmosphere: 10/10
Columbia (the city the game takes place in) is beautiful, and the variation between different zones is beautiful. A screenshot from anywhere in game looks like a painting. The music is fitting, the city feels alive, and while you don't always feel like you are miles off the ground, you always feel like you are in Columbia.

Gameplay: 8/10
Solid shooter mechanics, and a variety of weapons. The new plasmids, err tonics, are different enough to compliment a variety of play styles. The action is fast paced and very much -in your face-, so don't expect stealth mechanics, but the gun-play is much improved from the original Bioshock. The limit of two weapons at a time is also a welcomed addition, as it makes you wonder if carrying around an RPG for a boss is worth it when fighting individual units. 

Sound: 9/10
The voice acting is fantastic, and while the music is up to par with industry standards, doesn't really stand out all too much. There is only one point at which soundtrack really stood out to me, but even then it was only for a moment. For the most part the soundtrack is going ot be fast paced to match the gameplay, which works. Columbia, however, and the sounds of the machines and songs on the streets, work perfectly. 

Pros:
Great Story and Atmosphere
Solid Mechanics and Gameplay
Continues the BioShock story
Amazing Characterization

Cons:
Certain areas feel like filler
Strange difficulty spikes in some areas
Low-Medium Replayability
Some tonics you get too late into the game

Extra Notes: Looking forward to see where they go with DLC. There are some characters I'd like to see expanded (Songbird).
Più si va avanti e meglio è! Non cala mai di tono!
worth it just for the ending. comlete plot twist and I loved every second.
Awesome game, definitely got my thumbs up.
This is one game you're going to be talking about, and thinking about, even after you've completed it.

Awesome game, really excellent graphics and gameplay and an immersive story.  Elizabeth is a super-cool game addition and adds lots to the depth of the story without getting in the way: the game never feels like an "escort mission" because Elizabeth stays out of combat (and actually can't die) and helps you out as well.  My one gripe is that you can only have two weapons at a time, which makes the game ridiculously hard on 1999 mode.  My biggest cause of death is running out of ammo and salts and getting overwhelmed.  If you could have at least three weapons instead of two, it would be so much better.
Прекрасная графика, необычный сюжет, захватывающий геймплей. По-моему мнению, в нее хотя бы разок должен поиграть каждый. кто ценит атмосферу и особый стиль повествования!

Ótimo jogo de tiro combinado com uma história excepcional e com grandes reviravoltas.
Não fica devendo em nada para com os outros jogos da franquia.

Deep. There is a diference between depth and complexity, and this game is a grand example of depth's power of complexity. Since System Shock 2 Irrational has been moving away from the complex, and more towards depth, and this game is a milestone in that path.
Really, it is a wonderful game with a great story and unforgettable gameplay i reccomend this game to everyone : )
Just; woah.... I mean...wow...I don't even know. Epic and worth the playthrough.
Nicht ganz so krank wie Bioshock und Bioshock 2 aber storytechnisch trotzdem geil

I was confused when the story started, but I was not afraid, for the TRUE PHOPHET, KEVIN LEVINE, lead me the way. Into a terrific and gradifying experience. Well done good sir, it's a brilliant story when you have absolutely no idea what going to happen next, but you feel carried there safely.
game of the year!

An spetacular and fantastic game, from beginning to end. The gameplay is bioshock's standart: really fun, engaging, easy to learn and hard to master. The story, although a little confusing towards the end, is fantastic, with really strong characters. The world itself they created is absolutely amazing, well detailed and immersive, and it always has something to show. The presentation is as awesome and well done as it can be, with art beyond great, In short, it's a fantastic game everyone should give a try.

The story is great, but the gameplay could have been better. So if you prefer a great story above good gameplay mechanics, you will have a great time! 

Elizabeth (your companion throughout the game) makes the game feel very alive together with all the little details in the world.

One of the best pieces of storytelling i've ever exprienced. What System shock and bioshock did wrong this did right. Perfect game mechanics, amazing story, visualy stunning. If you don't play this you'll miss out on so much.

It's the kind of game where, after it ends, you take off your headphones, slide back into your chair, and say out loud: "What the f$#&."

An absolute blast the whole way through, and the first game where I don't mind having a partner for most of it.
I only have 3 words for this game epic awesome and mind blowing!
I completed this game twice now! I Love it! Very different to other Bioshocks and the storyline is amazing!! Must buy!
Единственная игра, пройдя которую, я сидел и аплодировал пока шли титры. Браво, Кен Левин!
O melhor jogo que joguei este ano. Recomendo muito este jogo para quem gosta de uma ótima história , ótimos gráficos e uma boa jogabilidade. Adorei
Nothing needs to be said, Just buy it.

Ich mag es trotz all seiner Schwächen, für die ich nicht blind bin und wo ich sogar mehr sehe als nur die, die alle herumsprechen.

Die Ästhetik der Spielwelt und ihre Hintergründe sind sehr detailiert und so ziemlich jeder Spielabschnitt ist visuell herausragend und erinnerungswert. Musik und soundeffekte und auch die Sprachausgabe sind von erstklassiker Qualität.

Die Geschichte ist raffiniert, aber nicht gerade logisch oder intelligent. Auch passiert im gesamten Mittelteil nichts von Relevanz, aber es hat immer noch mehr Handlung als die meisten Shooter. Bei einem erneuten Durchlauf merkt man, dass die Entscheidungen, die man gelegentlich trifft, keine Auswirkungen haben außer einer kosmetischen, was schade ist.

Innerhalb der Spielwelt gibt es einige Ungereimtheiten, die offensichtlich aufgrund mangelnder Differenzierung der Entwickler entstanden sind und andere aufgrund der anzunehmenden Vorgaben des Publishers Elemente des Franchises wiederzuverwenden. Das betrifft das Verhalten aller Figuren miteinander: NPCs mit dem Spieler, Gegner mit dem Spieler, Gegner mit deiner Gefährtin... es kommt zu einer Diskrepanz der Glaubwürdigkeit.

Die DLCs sind enttäuschend, weil sie Columbia nicht vertiefen sondern sich wieder auf Rapture berufen und nur Fanservice sind. Für sich genommen und spielerisch sind die wohl in Ordnung, nur versuchen die unvereinbare Dinge zu verbinden und es wird so getan als sei das von vornherein so geplant. Außerdem erfüllt Burial at sea nicht die angesetzten Erwartungen, so dass eine aufgeschlüsselte Geschichte daraus geworden wäre.

Dennoch habe ich für das Kernspiel viel Sympathie übrig, die teilweise irrational ist. Leider verbraucht sich der content recht schnell, aber es gibt mehr zum Nachdenken und zu entdecken als in vielen anderen Spielen und seien es auch kleine Eastereggs oder Makel. Es kommt sehr selten vor, dass ich gegenüber der Schlechtigkeit von etwas nicht zynisch reagiere, denn im Falle von Bioshock Infinite denke ich über alle pros und contras gerne nach.

Das hier ist ausführlicher:
https://youtu.be/fhaCpDSmgMw

Bioshock Infinite сделал поистине громадный шаг в сторону становления игр как искусства. То, что мы называем атмосферностью игры, собрано из мельчайших деталей: игрок наблюдает отнюдь не сценарические клише, которые, казалось бы, должны пробуждать определенные чувства, а ощущает происходящее напрямую, как бы невзначай.

Booker DeWitt - это тот самый протагонист, которого я всегда желал увидеть, но никак не мог встретить. Не пустая оболочка, прогоняемая по рельсам сюжета, а цельная, многогранная личность, далеко не всегда считающаяся с игроком в принятии решений. "Да что же он такое творит? Нужно было не так, не сейчас, по-другому..." - удивительно ощущать такие мысли, на самом деле.

Пожалуй, иногда слов недостаточно. Здесь, свою роль играет Elizabeth. Она воспринимается не просто компаньонкой или напарницей , а, что поразительно, частью главного героя: не только эмоционально, но и за счет механики игры. С уверенностью можно сказать, что такого совмещения персонажа и игрока до этого не было, пожалуй, нигде. 

Ken Levine делает всё для того, чтобы представить повествование должным образом: заставляет нас глубоко прочувствовать происходящее и с головой погрузиться в него, стать тем самым Booker'ом DeWitt'ом и буквально прожить за него эту историю. Финал дополняет эту картину, поднимая столько же много вопросов, сколько мало дает ответов, оперируя уже не просто человеческими жизнями и судьбами, а поистине высокими материями. 

Спасибо.
Mind-blowing ending. Definitely worth playing to the end.

As all the Bioshock games that came before it, this lives up to the hype and outside the box thinking (on the developers end) to leave me speachless when I finished it.

Well worth the money and your mind will be blown.

Awesome FPS! Great story telling, deep characters and beautiful game art. You MUST play this!
The ending will blow your mind...
sublime !!!

This is indubitably a fantastic game, it's different from other FPS games. Infinite does a good job of keeping the story mysterious while still feeding it to you so it's understandable. All these reasons and millions more contribute to me recommending it.
The best storyline I've seen to a game. Like it's predecessors, it's a bit hard to follow, but it has you sitting in awe as the credits roll.
This is where its at.

바이오쇼크 1편을 플레이 하지않아도 충분히 재미를 느낄 수 있는  게임입니다.
한번 쯤 소장하고 싶은 마음을 가지게 한다고 할까요.
娘を連れてくれば借金は帳消しだ

Great story line with realistic characters that keep everything real and lively for the player.  This game also had a great twist which was really unexpected.

At one point this game gave me chills down my spine because the story line was really surprising.
Fuck the Tea Party.
Fantastic game

It's been really long since I played an FPS as good as this. It really managed to catch me off-guard even though I expected a mindbender - last time I got such shivers of a singleplayer FPS was System Shock 2 back in 1999. No previous experience of the Bioshock series is necessary, as this is a stand-alone existential steampunk shooter. I can't praise it much without spoiling it, so I'll just say that it's definitely a classic and leave it at that.

Great game! An interesting story, good mechanics and graphics. The weapon selection seems a bit redundant, as do the enemies after a while, but a handfull of set piece moments brake it up and the settings are all top notch. I would give it an 8 / 10 at least.

Brilliant story, awe-inspiring art, excellent voice-acting. Some minor flaws in the combat system and a few glitches here and there are far from adequate to mar this gem of a game. On top of it all, its narrative delves into politics, religion, racism and... quantum physics of all things. A worthy successor to Bioshock, while at the same time taking a (parallel) path of its own.
Excelente historia, impresionante final.

Definitivamente o jogo do ano de 2013!

Assim como o primeiro Bioshock, este mantém a atmosfera retrô e steampunk e a imersão e tensão a todo o momento mesmo com os cenários grandiosos e belos. 
Falando nos gráficos, eles são muito bonitos e não requisitam uma configuração monstro para rodar no máximo.

A história do jogo é definitivamente muito bacana, tendo doses de complexidade que são discutidas internet à fora em foruns. Viagem no tempo, distorção temporal, paradoxos, e isso sem deixar de lado a parte emocional, não há como não se "apaixonar" por Elizabeth, uma personagem fortíssima assim como o protagonista que controlamos. Apesar de ser um FPS, este jogo possui uma história muito bem trabalhada, e como eu disse, personagens muito bem construídos. Um adendo, procure todos os Voxfones, pois partes muito interessantes da história estão lá, inclusive a construção da mítica do jogo.

Não há muito o que comparar em relação aos outros bioshocks, a mecânica é fabulosa, a jogabilidade excelente se mantém, o uso bem pensado do mouse para o uso dos poderes também. em alguns momentos o uso do hook se mostra uma das coisas mais bacanas do jogo, viajar pelos céus e atacar inimigos através de trilhos usando um gancho de mão é uma das experiencias mais bacanas que se pode ter num jogo, ainda mais sendo um bioshock.

Acho que o importante do jogo é isso, jogabilidade excelente, gráficos muito bonitos, personagens fortes, e uma história cativante. Se tem tudo isso, pra mim, pelo menos, já vale ser jogado, e Bioshock infinite tem isso tudo.
This game....is possibly one of the best games that I have ever played. The story is interesting, the upgrades are awesome and the ending is perfect, abiet sad. GOTY

It pretty much goes full circle, but it's an awesome game nonetheless. Awesome graphics, smooth gameplay, and interesting characters. Though summed up, it's basically an escort mission turned into a game but the person you are escorting isn't annoying and actually helpful. It might get confusing if you don't pay attention, but the story is worthy of the BioShock name.
Une aventure palpitante, des personnages très attachants, un univers ultra-riche, une direction artistique à couper le souffle..

Como todos os outros títulos da série, Bioshock Infinite não decepciona e aprimora o gameplay e enredo. O jogo contém muita violencia o que não fazia parte dos jogos anteriores, mas atraí um outro tipo de público amantes de FPS.

A exploração é essencial do jogo e a história é impressionante. Vale cada centavo gasto.
Mind fuck story line *-*
Brilliantly crazy and beautiful game. Couldn't ask for more.

Sale記念レビュー。
ゲームそのものはBioshock2より一段レベルアップした出来。
武器やプラスミド(今作ではビガー)の持ち替えがやりやすくなり、多様性のある戦闘への自由度はあがりました。また、(プレイ次第ではありますが)基本的に全てのビガーを持つことが出来るので、前作のようなプラスミドの取捨選択は薄くなりました。これに関しては、前作の「自分のチョイスで上げたプラスミドによる攻略」という部分が薄くなったとも言えるので諸手をあげて良いとはいえないかも。武器のアップグレード要素もあるものの、二種類までしか持つことが出来ないのがネック。せめて三つか四つぐらいは持ちたかったなーと思います。前作のリサーチもなくなったのが残念。

ストーリーに関してはネタバレになるので避けますが、とにかく頭が痛くなる話です。「主人公ががんばって(どういう形であれ)報われる」というシンプルな構成が好きな方は若干つらいかも。考察もさかんに行われており深いストーリーだとは思いますが、僕個人的には嫌いな方。

ゲーム内容:85点
ストーリー(好み):60点
頭痛い度数:100点
Tremenda historia con una ambientación muy original. Recomendado jugarlo en difícil.
В этой игре присутсвует один из самых отличных сюжетов. Лучше я пока что не видел.
THIS GAME IS SO AMAZING. I WAS HOOKED 5 MINUTES IN. IT IS SO AMAZING AND THE GRAPHICS ARE FREAKING RIDICULOUS. WHY HAVENT YOU BOUGHT IT YET DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND BUY THIS CLASSIC.

Good Shooter mechanics, a great (no I mean REALLY REALLY GREAT) story and probably the best character duo since Alyx and Gordon make this game the most memorable shooter in a very long time!
The only thing annoying me, is the constant repetition of character models in the game.......only 4 different persons seem to live in Columbia, thus destroying a huge amount of atmosphere!
Une ambiance Steampunk avant gardiste, une histoire éprouvante, des scènes intenses. Le jeu prend son envol vers la fin mais c'est un putain d'envol !
Buy it, play it, enjoy it.....
Hands down, my absolute favorite game of all time.

This game is amazing (and sort of hijacked my life). The gameplay was great, the story was amazing, and they give you tons of hints about how it's going to end all throughout the game. Heartily recommended, and my new favorite game of all time.
Esse jogo é fênomenal, vale muito a pena, vai além de um jogo.
Great story and Elizabeth is a hottie. I definitely recommend.
While being the first Bioshock game I've played, it certainly won't be the last. This was one of the most brilliant storylines I've ever experienced. Play. This. Game.

Fazia tempo que o enredo de um jogo não me deixava totalmente DESLUMBRADO.
Ótimo gameplay, fora as ações típicas de FPS há o incremento da mecânica dos Vigores ("magias") e a possibilidade de deslocamento nas Skylines, que acabaram por deixar as batalhas bem intensas e cheias de possibilidades.
Mas o que mais vale a pena mesmo deste jogo é o enredo cativante e surpreendente.
É obrigação pra quem se considera "gamer" ter o prazer de jogar e terminar esta obra de arte.
Recomendadíssimo.
10/10

THIS GAME IS A FLYING CITY OF CULT FAGGOTS. ALSO, GEORGE WASHINGTON IS A HORNY ROBOT. PROTECT THIS HOT BITCH YOU WANNA BANG IN THE ASS WHILE SHOOTING A SONGBIRD BEOTCH. COMING TO YOU FROM THOSE R/GAMING FAGGOTS ON REDDIT

De très loin le meilleur scénario de jeu auquel il m’ait été donné de jouer. En fait, je dirais même qu'il s'agit d'une des meilleures histoires dans laquelle je me sois jamais plongé, que ce soit en livre, film, jeu...

Au delà de l'histoire, le jeu est extrêmement bien réalisé. Le gameplay, bien que différant quelque peu de celui des deux précédents opus, est rendu d’autant plus agréable que c’est un véritable plaisir de progresser en compagnie d’Elisabeth qui, en plus d’être indispensable à la progression, est un personnage absolument attachant.

Si je ne devais donner qu’un conseil (autre que « jouez à ce jeu ! ») : Do. Not. Google. Bioshock. Infinite.
Croyez moi, vous regretteriez très amèrement de vous spoiler la moindre seconde de ce jeu.
One of my favourite games of all time. The themes and ideas, which run throughout the game are vastly interesting. A definite must play.

Bioshock Infinite ein gelungener Egoshooter mit guter Story und noch besser gestalteten Charaktären. Wer allerding wieder eine starke politische Auseinandersetzung mit den Problematiken der Stadt ( wie bei Bioshock 1) wünscht, wird hier unter umständen enttäuscht werden.

It's pretty good. The setting is fanciful and imaginative, and at times grippingly visceral, but the action is pretty samey. Once you've figured out your favorite way to shoot or nuke someone, it'll serve you for the rest of the game. I'm a bit disappointed that the writers couldn't end the game better than a press-W-to-keep-walking infodump, though.

"When I was a girl, I dreamt of standing in a room looking at a girl who was and was not myself, who stood looking at another girl, who also was and was not myself. My mother took this for a nightmare. I saw it as the beginning of a career in physics."
Love the Bioshock Series and Infinite did not let me down. With its Stunning Levels and Amazing Game Machanics this game is a Must Buy for all Gamers.
I recommend this game!

Fuck this fucking game. I beat this game and just didn't know what to do with myself. The ending fucked me so hard I had to go outside scream at the sky and smoke a cigarette. Video games aren't this, damn it, there finding bliss within ignorance and simplicity. Not your multi-dimension theories bullshit. This game doesn't even exist according to itself!
Masterpiece

Концовку понимать придётся оочень долго.
Ииии после прохождения игру я сразу удалил, надолго не затянула...
Bioshock!
A most extrordinary game, Well worth my time to write something good about it, a must play for anyone that likes infinite possibilities

História e enredo do jogo muito genial e principalmente o ending dele. Vou escrever pouco, pq não quero spoilar.

Jogabilidade bem simples e fluida, é bem violento e conta uma parte da história da 'Murica.

Awesome game with some mind bending twists.
One of my favorite games of all time well made and very good story.

Troisième volet de la mythique série des Bioshock, on y retrouve les mêmes mécanismes des précédents opus, mais dans un univers moins sombre, très coloré. La cité volante de Columbia a été créée avec un extrême souci du détail et le scénario vous tiendra en haleine. Un jeu incontournable.
This game is amazing, the story and the atmosphere is so good that I rate this as a must-play game, and this is a game that is fun to play over and over again.
Espectacular y apasionante, aunque quizás un poco corto. De las mejores historias que he jugado, mejor que muchos libros que he leído. 10/10
